identity: the majority of Earth's population believes Balder to be a mythological figure
knownrelatives: Buri (Tiwaz, great-grandfather); Bor (grandfather, deceased); Odin (father, deceased); Frigga (mother); Hermod, Tyr (brothers); Thor, Vidar (half-brothers); Loki (step-brother); Ve, Vili (uncles, deceased); Hoder (cousin); Mimir (granduncle)
powers: Balder has the ability to radiate unmeasured degrees of heat and light; like all Asgardians, Balder is extremely long-lived, and immune to terrestrial diseases.  Also, while in Asgard, Balder cannot be mortally wounded by any weapon, with the exception of mistletoe.
significantissues: served as ruler of Asgard in Thor's stead (Thor #255, 1978)
shot by Hoder with Mistletoe, but was held in suspended animation by Odin to stop Ragnarok (Thor #274-275, 1978)
brought back by Odin, but renounces his warrior lifestyle (Thor #301-302, 1980)
